key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fails to list 91.94% of Philippine Airlines ODs, signaling significant distribution shortfalls despite perfect parity where listed.
MSE delivers lower fares on 62.28% of itineraries with an average 0.11% discount, while parity share climbs to 37.72% and premiums remain zero.
GDS premiums affect 75.1% of bookings last week, with long-haul markups reaching 8% and far-out windows seeing an 87% premium incidence.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA fails to list 91.94% of ODs in the latest week, up +0.62% month-over-month, signaling distribution shortfalls.
7.76% of OTA offers match exactly with the website last week, showing zero variance across weeks and months.
Only 0.10% of OTA itineraries carry a premium (avg +0.11%) and 0.20% carry a discount (avg -0.14%), indicating negligible pricing deviations.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 91.94% of ODs were unlisted on OTA last week, rising +0.44% week-over-week and +0.62% month-over-month.
Exact-match offers account for 7.76% last week, slipping -0.25% week-over-week and -0.51% month-over-month, with zero price deviation.
Premium itineraries represent just 0.10% of OTA offers last week, down -0.19% week-over-week, with an average markup of +0.11%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes are missing on OTA 96.71% of the time (up +0.32% week-over-week), with exact matches at 3.07% and max deviations under ±10.2%.
Long-haul offers are missing 50.00% of the time (improved -0.93% week-over-week), with exact matches at 48.11% and discounts of -0.12% on 1.89% of listings.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All 14 PH ODs are unlisted on OTA (100% missing) consistently across weeks and months.
Non-Philippine ODs show 3.53% missing offers last week (up +1.28%), 92.94% exact matches, 1.18% with +0.11% premiums and 2.35% with -0.14% discounts.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 91.62% of close-in itineraries are missing (up +0.41% month-over-month), with 7.94% exact matches, 0.15% premiums (+0.11%) and 0.29% discounts (-0.17%).
Far-out itineraries see a 92.60% missing rate (up +1.06% month-over-month), 7.10% exact matches, no premiums and 0.30% discounts averaging -0.06%.

mse_highlights.line_content: 62.28% of ODs on MSE were priced lower than the website last week, delivering an average discount of 0.11%.
Same-priced fares on MSE climbed to 37.72% last week, up 4.42% week-over-week and 3.72% month-over-month.
There are no instances of MSE fares exceeding website rates, confirming a zero share for higher-priced listings.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE lower-price listings remain the majority at 62.28%, despite a 4.13% week-over-week and 3.62% month-over-month decrease.
Same-price offerings on MSE reached 37.72%, reflecting a 4.42% week-over-week and 3.72% month-over-month gain.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 58.00% lower fares on MSE last week (down 4.62% week-over-week), while parity listings rose to 42.00% (+4.95%).
Long-haul itineraries exhibited 98.11% lower fares with negligible week-over-week movement, highlighting stable deep discounting.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For PH origins, 58.99% of ODs were cheaper on MSE with an average 0.10% discount, though share declined 4.43% week-over-week.
Non-PH origins saw 98.81% lower-priced itineraries on MSE, up 1.06% week-over-week, averaging a 0.17% price advantage.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings held 71.18% lower fares (down 4.67% week-over-week), while same-priced share increased to 28.82%.
Far-out bookings featured 55.62% same-priced fares (up 3.74% week-over-week), reducing lower-price share to 44.38%.

gds_highlights.line_content: 75.1% of itineraries on GDS were priced above the website last week, marking a 3.5% week-over-week increase.
Average GDS prices for long-haul routes carry an 8% markup—double the 4% seen on short-haul.
Far-out booking windows exhibit the highest GDS premium share at 87.0%, with price differentials rising 5% month-over-month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 75.12% of PR itineraries on GDS were more expensive than the website last week, up 3.54% week-over-week and 3.71% month-over-month.
20.45% of fares matched website pricing last week, down 4.65% week-over-week and 3.95% month-over-month.
Only 3.34% of GDS fares were lower than the website last week, remaining broadly flat week-over-week.
1.08% of website offers were unavailable on GDS last week, a slight increase of 0.89% versus the prior week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 78.20% of short-haul fares on GDS carried a 4% average premium last week (up 3.89% week-over-week), while parity cases fell to 18.07%.
48.11% of long-haul itineraries were priced above the website with an 8% markup (flat month-over-month, down 0.51% week-over-week) and 41.51% at parity.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 81.89% of PH-origin fares on GDS were more expensive last week (up 3.54% week-over-week) with a consistent 4% average premium.
85.71% of non-PH itineraries matched website prices last week (down 9.74% week-over-week), with 11.90% unavailable and negligible premiums.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 69.12% of close-in fares were more expensive on GDS (up 4.76% week-over-week) with a 4% average premium and 25.29% parity.
86.98% of far-out itineraries carried a 4–5% premium on GDS (up 1.48% week-over-week, 3.26% month-over-month), with parity at 10.65%.
